cell2d.space

Class Hitbox<T extends CellGame>

  • java.lang.Object
    • cell2d.space.Hitbox<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The subclass of CellGame that uses the SpaceStates that can use this Hitbox
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CircleHitbox, CompositeHitbox, LineHitbox, PointHitbox, PolygonHitbox, RectangleHitbox

    public abstract class Hitbox<T extends CellGame>
extends java.lang.Object

    A Hitbox is a region of space that can be checked for intersection with other regions. A Hitbox has a position at a single point that acts as an origin point for the Hitbox's shape. This point is usually inside the Hitbox, but may not always be. Hitboxes can be rotated around their positions and flipped across horizontal and vertical axes through their positions. Rotating a Hitbox will also rotate the axes along which it is flipped. As with CellVectors, Hitboxes measure angles in degrees going counterclockwise from directly right and normalize them to be between 0 and 360.

    If a Hitbox is a component of a CompositeHitbox, its position, flipped status, and angle of rotation are all relative to those of the CompositeHitbox. The same is true of a Hitbox being used by a SpaceObject, but not as its locator Hitbox, in relation to that SpaceObject's locator Hitbox. To avoid confusion, all spatial information about a Hitbox is specified as relative or absolute. For Hitboxes which are not located relative to other Hitboxes in this way, the two types of information are identical.

    A Hitbox stores information on whether its surfaces in each Direction are solid, but this only affects its behavior when being used as a SpaceObject's solid Hitbox.

        Returns:
        This Hitbox's relative angle of rotation

      • getRelAngleX

        public final long getRelAngleX()
        Returns the x-coordinate of the unit vector that points in the direction of this Hitbox's relative angle of rotation. This is equal to the cosine of the angle.
        Returns:
        The x-coordinate of this Hitbox's relative angle of rotation

      • getRelAngleY

        public final long getRelAngleY()
        Returns the y-coordinate of the unit vector that points in the direction of this Hitbox's relative angle of rotation. Since y-coordinates increase going downward, this is equal to the negative sine of the angle.
        Returns:
        The y-coordinate of this Hitbox's relative angle of rotation

      • overlaps

        public final boolean overlaps(Hitbox<T> hitbox)
        Returns whether this Hitbox overlaps the specified Hitbox. Two Hitboxes are not considered to overlap if they are both being used by the same SpaceObject.
        Parameters:
        hitbox - The Hitbox to check for an overlap
        Returns:
        Whether this Hitbox overlaps the specified Hitbox

      • overlap

        public static final <T extends CellGame> boolean overlap(Hitbox<T> hitbox1,
                                                         Hitbox<T> hitbox2)
        Returns whether the two specified Hitboxes overlap. Two Hitboxes are not considered to overlap if they are both being used by the same SpaceObject.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The subclass of CellGame that uses the SpaceStates that the two Hitboxes can be used by
        Parameters:
        hitbox1 - The first Hitbox
        hitbox2 - The second Hitbox
        Returns:
        Whether the two Hitboxes overlap
